com.chaining

Class Chain<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.chaining.Chain<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    And<T>, DefaultIfEmpty<T>, Monad<T>, io.reactivex.functions.Function<io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T>,Chain<T>>, java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>

    public class Chain<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements io.reactivex.functions.Function<io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T>,Chain<T>>, java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>, DefaultIfEmpty<T>, And<T>, Monad<T>
    a class that encapsulates chaining multiple operations to be invoked on an Object through chained sequence of operations, then you can get the Object finally through calling call()

    Created by Ahmed Adel Ismail on 10/29/2017.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collector<T> and(T item)
      add the item to the group of items to be used all together later on
      Chain<T> apply(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
      apply an action to the stored item
      T call()
      call the Object after being updated
      static <T> Chain<T> call(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> callable)
      start a chain of Functions throw passing a Callable that will return the root item
      <R> Collector<R> collect(java.lang.Class<R> type)
      collect the stored Iterable item into a Collector Object, if the stored item is not of type Iterable, this method will create a Collector with a List of one item, which is the stored item, you can then invoke Collector.and(Object) to append other items to the current items
      Chain<T> debug(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
      invoke the passed Consumer if the Application is in the debug mode, you can set the debugging mode in ChainConfiguration in the Application's onCreate()
      Chain<T> defaultIfEmpty(T defaultValue)
      if the root item is converted to null due to any operation (like map() for example), this function will set it to a new default value
      <R> R flatMap(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> flatMapper)
      a flat map function that converts the item held in this Object to another Object
      Guard<T> guard(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
      invoke an action on the root item that may throw an Exception
      Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,java.lang.Boolean>> in(java.util.Collection<T> collection)
      check if the current Object in the chain is available in the passed Collection, the comparison will be through Object.equals(Object), if you need custom comparison, you can use in(Collection, BiPredicate) instead
      Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,java.lang.Boolean>> in(java.util.Collection<T> collection, io.reactivex.functions.BiPredicate<T,T> comparator)
      check if the current Object in the chain is available in the passed Collection
      Chain<T> invoke(io.reactivex.functions.Action action)
      invoke an action before going to the next step in this chain, this operation is intended for side-effects
      static <T> Chain<T> let(T item)
      start a chain of Functions throw passing an item
      <R> Chain<R> map(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> mapper)
      a map function to convert the current Object in the Chain to another Object
      static <T> Optional<T> optional(T item)
      create an Optional Object that may contain a value, or may not ...
      <R> Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,R>> pair(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> pairedItemMapper)
      pair the current item with another item which is the result of the passed function
      <R> Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,R>> pair(R item)
      pair the current item with another item
      <R> Chain<R> to(java.util.concurrent.Callable<R> itemCallable)
      convert the current Chain to another Chain
      <R> Chain<R> to(R item)
      convert the current Chain to another Chain
      Condition<T> when(io.reactivex.functions.Predicate<T> predicate)
      pass a Predicate that if it returned true, it's Condition.then(Consumer) will update the current Object, else nothing will happen
      Condition<T> whenNot(io.reactivex.functions.Predicate<T> predicate)
      pass a Predicate that if it returned false, it's Condition.then(Consumer) will update the current Object, else nothing will happen

      • when

        public Condition<T> when(io.reactivex.functions.Predicate<T> predicate)
        pass a Predicate that if it returned true, it's Condition.then(Consumer) will update the current Object, else nothing will happen
        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate that will decide weather the Condition.then(Consumer) will update the current Object or not
        Returns:
        a Condition to supply it's Condition.then(Consumer) Consumer

      • whenNot

        public Condition<T> whenNot(io.reactivex.functions.Predicate<T> predicate)
        pass a Predicate that if it returned false, it's Condition.then(Consumer) will update the current Object, else nothing will happen
        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate that will decide weather the Condition.then(Consumer) will update the current Object or not
        Returns:
        a Condition to supply it's Condition.then(Consumer) Consumer

      • in

        public Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,java.lang.Boolean>> in(java.util.Collection<T> collection)
        check if the current Object in the chain is available in the passed Collection, the comparison will be through Object.equals(Object), if you need custom comparison, you can use in(Collection, BiPredicate) instead
        Parameters:
        collection - the Collection that holds the items
        Returns:
        a new Chain holding a Pair, where Pair.getValue0() will return the original Object, and Pair.getValue1() will return a boolean indicating weather the the Object was found in the passed Collection or not

      • in

        public Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,java.lang.Boolean>> in(java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                                          io.reactivex.functions.BiPredicate<T,T> comparator)
        check if the current Object in the chain is available in the passed Collection
        Parameters:
        collection - the Collection that holds the items
        comparator - the BiPredicate that will be invoked over every item, the stored Object will be passed as it's first parameter, and the item in the Collection will be passed as the second parameter, if the returned value is true, this means that both items are equal, if the returned item is false, they do not match
        Returns:
        a new Chain holding a Pair, where Pair.getValue0() will return the original Object, and Pair.getValue1() will return a boolean indicating weather the the Object was found in the passed Collection or not

      • defaultIfEmpty

        public Chain<T> defaultIfEmpty(@NonNull
                               T defaultValue)
        Description copied from interface: DefaultIfEmpty
        if the root item is converted to null due to any operation (like map() for example), this function will set it to a new default value
        Specified by:
        defaultIfEmpty in interface DefaultIfEmpty<T>
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value if the Object is null
        Returns:
        a new Chain with the default value, if the current Chain was broken by a null root, else it will return the same Chain to continue

      • debug

        public Chain<T> debug(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T> action)
        invoke the passed Consumer if the Application is in the debug mode, you can set the debugging mode in ChainConfiguration in the Application's onCreate()
        Parameters:
        action - a Consumer to be invoked in debugging only

      • pair

        public <R> Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,R>> pair(R item)
        pair the current item with another item
        Type Parameters:
        R - the other item type
        Parameters:
        item - another item to be paired with
        Returns:
        a Chain that holds a Pair, holding the current item as it's first value, and the new Item as a second Value

      • pair

        public <R> Chain<org.javatuples.Pair<T,R>> pair(io.reactivex.functions.Function<T,R> pairedItemMapper)
        pair the current item with another item which is the result of the passed function
        Type Parameters:
        R - the other item type
        Parameters:
        pairedItemMapper - a function that it's result will be used to be put in a Pair
        Returns:
        a Chain that holds a Pair, holding the current item as it's first value, and the function result as a second value

      • collect

        public <R> Collector<R> collect(java.lang.Class<R> type)
        collect the stored Iterable item into a Collector Object, if the stored item is not of type Iterable, this method will create a Collector with a List of one item, which is the stored item, you can then invoke Collector.and(Object) to append other items to the current items
        Type Parameters:
        R - the expected type of elements to collect over
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the elements in the stored Iterable item
        Returns:
        a Collector for managing those items
